abstract: Wal-Mart, the world’s biggest retailer, may scale back its $4 billion bid for Massmart by nearly half, the target company said Thursday — a move that could keep the South African firm listed in Johannesburg.
snippet: Wal-Mart, the world’s biggest retailer, may scale back its $4 billion bid for Massmart by nearly half, the target company said Thursday — a move that could keep the South African firm listed in Johannesburg.
lead_paragraph: Wal-Mart Stores, which has made a $4 billion takeover offer for Massmart of South Africa, may now instead be cutting its offer by nearly half, Massmart said on Thursday — a move that could leave it listed in Johannesburg, Reuters reports.

headline.main: Wal-Mart May Pare Offer for Massmart
